intro: Amellus floribundus, commonly known as the showy bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Amellus floribundus is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
